title: 112_hr4373
content: The Act titled "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" provides expanded tax benefits for adoption that are made permanent. The "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" made expansions enacted in 2001 permanent and expansions enacted in 2010 permanently reinstated, including an increase in the dollar limitation for adoption credits. The "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" permanently increased the dollar limitation for adoption credits to $13,170, with adjustments for inflation starting from December 31, 2010. The dollar amounts for adoption credits are increased annually based on the cost-of-living adjustment determined for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins. If the increased amount is not a multiple of $10, it will be rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. The dollar amounts for adoption credits are adjusted annually based on the cost-of-living adjustment for the year the taxable year begins. If the increased amount is not a multiple of $10, it will be rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. Adoption assistance programs have seen an increase in the dollar limitation from $10,000 to $13,170. The adoption credit dollar limitation has been increased from $10,000 to $13,170 for children with special needs, with adjustments for inflation starting from December 31, 2010. The dollar amounts in subsections (a)(2) and (b)(1) will be increased for taxable years after December 31, 2010, based on the cost-of-living adjustment determined for the calendar year. If the adjusted amount is not a multiple of $10, it will be rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. The dollar amounts in subsections (a)(2) and (b)(1) will be increased for taxable years after December 31, 2010, based on the cost-of-living adjustment determined for the calendar year. If any increased amount is not a multiple of $10, it will be rounded to the nearest multiple of $10. Additionally, the credit is made refundable by moving it to a subpart relating to refundable credits in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to redesignate section 23 as section 36C and move it to a new location. Conforming amendments are made to other sections of the Code. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by redesignating section 23 as section 36C and making conforming amendments to other sections of the Code by striking references to section 23. Section 30D(c)(2)(B)(ii) of the Internal Revenue Code is amended by removing references to section 23 and inserting "section". Additionally, sections 36C, 137, 904(i), and 1016(a)(26) of the Code are amended by removing references to section 23 and making corresponding changes. Section 36C is amended in various sections of the Internal Revenue Code by removing references to section 23 and making corresponding changes. Section 1324(b) of title 31, United States Code is amended by inserting "36C," after "36B," and the table of sections for subpart C of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is updated accordingly. The amendments made by this subsection relate to adoption expenses and have an effective date for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2011.
